Questions.QuestionText: Based on the case study, what is the first thing you will do?
Questions.AnswerText: The first step in any window covering calculation is to draw the window to ½ inch scale on graph paper to include measurements.

Questions.QuestionText: You must now calculate the width of the a single panel @ 54" fabric width. What is the formula you use to do this? Hint: use "/" for divide and "*" for multiply.
What is the correct width of a single panel? Remember, there is also a relaxes width, so give the actual and relaxed values.
Now calculate the length. What is the formula you use to do this and one with a pattern repeat?
Questions.AnswerText:
9' ceiling (108") - ½" from floor - 1 inch from ceiling
For pattern repeat: add the pattern repeat of 27" + 16" hem and header

Questions.QuestionText: What is the correct length of a single panel and with and without a pattern? Give the actual and relaxed values.
Questions.AnswerText:
Single plain panel: 19.2" or 18" relaxed
With pattern repeat: 149.5" order/purchase lenght per panel.

Questions.QuestionText: Now that you have the  measurements for a single panel, what is the formula and the answer for the minimum number of yards of fabric you will need to order for 2 single panels? Round up to the nearest half yard.
Questions.AnswerText:
149.5 inches x 2 / 36 (number of inches in a yard).
The answer is 8.3 yards, rounded up to 8.5 yards minimum to order.
